papers.abstract: This article cross-culturally compares the German remake of the Quebec sketch comedy/sitcom series Un Gars, Une Fille ('A Guy and a Girl') the original version by correlating quantitative data derived from the Adobe Premiere Pro annotation function on the duration of narrative segments and incorporating these data into an interpretation of family conflict management strategies, gender roles and conflicts between the mother-in-law and the young 30-something couple as protagonists. The article examines a scene in which the daughter confronts her mother's trauma-inducing behavior on her as a young girl, and the boyfriend confronts the mother-in-law's animosity toward him. The article delves into the background for the transactional, belligerent, and obligational thinking behind the family relationship of the German couple compared to the more affectionate and conciliatory relationship in all other versions. The investigation postulates that the family relationships in the German context must be seen within the context of the Inability to Mourn, a major psychological study by Margarete and Alexander Mitscherlich in the 1960s of politically salient post World War 2 trauma among a large variety of social groups in West (and East) Germany. The emotional repression as a result of various forms of guilt, which never explicitly surfaced in the confrontations, was passed down from generation to generation, while this same, or similar social psychological contexts was seemingly not a factor in other countries, many of which had also experienced repressive dictatorships during World War 2 and afterwards, in which adaptations of these series were produced. Further collaborative investigations would be required to uncover the reasons for this discrepancy.

events.Text: This article cross-culturally compares the German remake of the Quebec sketch comedy/sitcom series Un Gars, Une Fille ('A Guy and a Girl') the original version by correlating quantitative data derived from the Adobe Premiere Pro annotation function on the duration of narrative segments and incorporating these data into an interpretation of family conflict management strategies, gender roles and conflicts between the mother-in-law and the young 30-something couple as protagonists.

Primary Object: the German remake of the Quebec sketch comedy/sitcom series Un Gars, Une Fille
Secondary Object: quantitative data derived from the Adobe Premiere Pro annotation function

Purpose: examining how the German remake reflects cultural shifts
Method: using Adobe Premiere Pro for quantifying the duration of narrative segments
integrating these data into an interpretation
Results: correlating quantitative data and interpreting family conflict management strategies
Implications: suggesting ways cultural remakes can reflect societal changes

events.Text: The article examines a scene in which the daughter confronts her mother's trauma-inducing behavior on her as a young girl, and the boyfriend confronts the mother-in-law's animosity toward him. The article delves into the background for the transactional, belligerent, and obligational thinking behind the family relationship of the German couple compared to the more affectionate and conciliatory relationship in all other versions.
events.Main Action: The daughter confronts her mother's trauma-inducing behavior

Context: The family relationship of the German couple compared to the more affectionate and conciliatory relationship in all other versions
Purpose: Delving into the background for the transactional, belligerent, and obligational thinking behind the family relationship
Results: Findings reveal differences in family interaction styles leading to varied emotional impacts
Analysis: Interpretation of the observed behavioral patterns and their psychological effects
Ethical: Potential emotional sensitivity and privacy concerns in personal dynamics research
Implications: Understanding family dynamics to foster healthier relationships and address underlying issues
Contradictions: Previous studies suggesting uniform family interaction norms

events.Text: The investigation postulates that the family relationships in the German context must be seen within the context of the Inability to Mourn, a major psychological study by Margarete and Alexander Mitscherlich in the 1960s of politically salient post World War 2 trauma among a large variety of social groups in West (and East) Germany.

Primary Object: family relationships in the German context
Secondary Object: politically salient post World War II trauma

Context: a major psychological study by Margarete and Alexander Mitscherlich in the 1960s of politically salient post World War 2 trauma among a large variety of social groups in West (and East) Germany

events.Text: The emotional repression as a result of various forms of guilt, which never explicitly surfaced in the confrontations, was passed down from generation to generation, while this same, or similar social psychological contexts was seemingly not a factor in other countries, many of which had also experienced repressive dictatorships during World War 2 and afterwards, in which adaptations of these series were produced. Further collaborative investigations would be required to uncover the reasons for this discrepancy.
events.Main Action: The emotional repression as a result of various forms of guilt

Context: while this same, or similar social psychological contexts was seemingly not a factor in other countries, many of which had also experienced repressive dictatorships during World War 2 and afterwards
Purpose: Further collaborative investigations would be required to uncover the reasons for this discrepancy.
Implications: This discrepancy may suggest cultural differences in the manifestation of emotional repression and its influence on mental health outcomes.

papers.abstract: This paper proposes text alignment in digital environments as a way to empower language learning. It presents the principles and goals of text alignment in Natural Language Processing, and introduces Ugarit, a web-based translation alignment editor for the collection of aligned language pairs. Then, it reports observations on the application of translation alignment in historical language courses at Tufts and Furman University between 2017 and 2019.

events.Text: This paper proposes text alignment in digital environments as a way to empower language learning.

Purpose: as a way to empower language learning

events.Text: It presents the principles and goals of text alignment in Natural Language Processing, and introduces Ugarit, a web-based translation alignment editor for the collection of aligned language pairs.
Then, it reports observations on the application of translation alignment in historical language courses at Tufts and Furman University between 2017 and 2019.

Purpose: To understand the effectiveness of translation alignment in historical language courses
Results: Observations on the application of translation alignment
